meanings.definition: A hormone secreted by the pituitary gland that stimulates the adrenal cortex to produce corticosteroids.
meanings.sent1: The adrenocorticotrophins from the pituitary gland help the adrenal cortex make corticosteroids.
meanings.sent2: Doctors sometimes use adrenocorticotrophins to treat certain medical conditions.
meanings.sent3: The adrenocorticotrophins threw a party in the pituitary gland to celebrate their role in making corticosteroids.
meanings.sent4: Her energy was like adrenocorticotrophins, sparking life into every corner of the adrenal cortex.
meanings.sent5: The adrenocorticotrophins acted like a cheerleader, motivating the adrenal cortex to produce corticosteroids.

meanings.definition: Substances that stimulate the production of corticosteroids by the adrenal cortex.
meanings.sent1: Athletes should avoid using supplements containing adrenocorticotrophins.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying the effects of different adrenocorticotrophins on the adrenal cortex.
meanings.sent3: The adrenocorticotrophins in the lab were mischievous, playing pranks on the corticosteroids.
meanings.sent4: In the body's orchestra, adrenocorticotrophins are the conductors, directing the adrenal cortex to play corticosteroid melodies.
meanings.sent5: The adrenocorticotrophins were like alarm clocks, waking up the adrenal cortex to produce corticosteroids.
